meanings.definition: A line where two pieces of fabric are sewn together.
meanings.sent1: The seam on the shirt was neatly stitched.
meanings.sent2: She ironed the seam to make it flat.
meanings.sent3: The seam on the dress unraveled in the washing machine.
meanings.sent4: The seam of friendship between them never broke.
meanings.sent5: The seam of the quilt held all the memories together.

meanings.sent1: The seam of paint on the wall was barely visible.
meanings.sent2: The seam of ice on the pond was fragile.
meanings.sent3: The seam of frosting on the cake was too thick.
meanings.sent4: The seam of fog covered the entire valley.
meanings.sent5: The seam of darkness enveloped the room.

meanings.definition: A line or ridge formed by the joining together of two edges or surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The seam where the walls met was uneven.
meanings.sent2: The seam in the sidewalk caused a trip hazard.
meanings.sent3: The seam in the paper created a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The seam of the mountain range stretched for miles.
meanings.sent5: The seam of the book cover was embossed with gold.
